reviews.review: Epic in every sense this is the best Marvel movie to date. Great action, humor and THE villain !
The movie... You just can't express it in one word. I just want to spoil it but I'm going to hold myself from doing so. I'll say one thing: Thanos is a badass.

Though it does feel like a Part 1, Avengers: Infinity War lives up to its hype. Great special effects, amazing action sequences and the movie manages to balance out its darker tone with a healthy dose of humour. All of which culminates in an ending that left me speechless. Even the post-credits scene leaves you like this. Josh Brolin's takeover of the MCU HAS BEGUN!!! No-one is safe. Not even Fox ;)

I went in expecting an Avengers movie and instead it is half of a movie - the other half will be released next year. It is a horror movie. The villain spends the movie killing and torturing both ordinary people and humans.

History's highest grossing film franchise consists of disparate perspectives of the same "universe." Thor, Iron Man, Hulk, Captain America, Dr. Strange, Spider-Man, Black Panther, and the Guardians of the Galaxy each elicit sympathy to their unique view of what's right and wrong via movies focusing on them, but they all agree on one thing: Thanos is wrong. Never before did we question the absoluteness of Thanos' evil nature, or dream he might see himself and his purpose as righteous. Infinity War is the story of the MCU from Thanos' point of view. We hear his argument, understand his purpose, feel his passion and pain, and resist empathizing with his repugnant conclusion. The world's highest grossing opening-weekend movie did not receive positive reviews from universalists who want to live in a world where righteousness is absolute, and solutions are black and white. Killing Thanos would be much easier than trying to find a more humane resolution that covers his concerns. The only problem is that killing him won't make his concerns go away. Thanos demonstrates their legitimacy, and proves he is willing to sacrifice as much as anyone else in making hard decisions to mitigate their effect.
Movie is incredible !! Ending blown my mind !!
I couldn't fault it for story, pacing and emotion.

After Black Panther I thought I'd never see a movie again to that level of across the board enjoyment from Marvel. The Russo Bros. Proved me wrong. This film is not only the greatest Superhero film Ive ever seen... its the best movie Ive ever seen. The story was compelling. The acting was amazing. The CGI was top notch. Kevin. F. and The Russo Bros. are everything  Kathleen Kennedy and Rian Johnson WISHED they could be. And theyve done with Avengers Infinity War EVERYTHING that Rian Johnson exclaimed that he wanted to do with TLJ but failed miserably. Avengers Infinity War is a cinematic masterpiece. 5 Stars.

GREAT action flick if you follow the Marvel movies (I pity the fool that watches this stand alone).  I love how all the characters tie together (example: Rocket and Buckey's arm or Thor's eye).  There is a LOT going on, and even at 2.5 hours, it still feels like not enough time.
Like most ensemble movies, each character wasn't given enough time.  But the fact that there were the OTHER dozen Marvel movies makes up for that.  The original Avengers 1 felt much less developed as there were not as many backstories yes.
Also appreciated that the characters didn't make obvious dumb choices (looking at you 'Last Jedi') - even when Strange handed over the Time stone, I suspect he did it because he saw that was the only future where they win.
My only real gripe with the movie was the power of the gauntlet.  Once the Avengers get their hands on it, they can just undo everything that happened in this movie, and nothing that happened means anything.
